src.scoring.ska_sdc.common.utils.cat_io.load_dataframe(cat_path, columns, skip_n=0)[source]

Load the catalogue specified by the input path into memory as a pd.DataFrame.

Drop rows containing NaN values.

Parameters

  • cat_path (str) – File path of csv catalogue

  • skip_n (int) (opt) – Number of lines to skip when reading catalogue

src.scoring.ska_sdc.common.utils.score_helper.count_match_cat_rej(match_df, multid_thr)[source]

Count the number of matches in match_df with a multi_d_err above threshold.

Parameters

match_df (pd.DataFrame) – Candidate match DataFrame with calculated multi_d_err column which will be used to accept/reject

src.scoring.ska_sdc.common.utils.score_helper.get_acc_series(sub_s, truth_s, scaling)[source]

Calculate a generic accuracy series based on passed measured and truth values according to:

acc_s = abs(sub_s - truth_s) / scaling

Scaling can either be a scalar or an iterable of the same length.

Parameters

  • sub_s (pandas.Series) – Submitted (measured) value series.

  • truth_s (pandas.Series) – True value series.

  • scaling (pandas.Series or float64) – Scaling factor(s)

src.scoring.ska_sdc.common.utils.score_helper.get_match_cat_acc(match_df, multid_thr)[source]

Given the passed match dataframe, split by the multi_d_err property around the multid_thr threshold value.

Return the accepted matches.

Parameters

match_df (pd.DataFrame) – Candidate match DataFrame with calculated multi_d_err column which will be used to accept/reject

scoring.ska_sdc.common.utils.xmatch module

class src.scoring.ska_sdc.common.utils.xmatch.KDTreeXMatch(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: XMatch

Abstract base class for KDTree-based XMatch processes.

These will query for candidate matches within a defined radius of a set of points in an N-D space.

crossmatch_kdtree()[source]

Query for all submitted sources within a defined radius of the truth catalogue.

Uses subclass-overridden methods to construct the KDTree, radius array and query arrays. Subclass must also define the columns to be written to the output catalogue.

Returns

The candidate match catalogue.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

abstract get_radius_arr()[source]

get_truth_suffix()[source]

Get the suffix label to be added to columns corresponding to truth properties.

Can be overridden by subclasses.

refine_match_df(cand_match_df)[source]

Can be overridden by subclasses to perform any minor post-xmatch refinement of the candidate match DataFrame.

This may include renaming columns, changing the index, etc. - more extensive operations should be separated.
